refnamediv.refpurpose: transform an LPE so that timed arguments are removed

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Transform a (timed) linear process equation (LPE) in &infile; by rewriting it, and in the process removing the timed argument. Write the resulting LPE to &outfile;. If &outfile; is not supplied the resulting LPE is written to &stdout;.

This tool takes an LPE from &infile; which is of the form: proc P(d:D) = sum e0:E0 c0(d,e0) -> a0(f0(d,e0))@t0(d,e0) . P(g0(d,e0)) + sum e1:E1 c1(d,e1) -> a1(f1(d,e1))@t1(d,e1) . P(g1(d,e1)) + ...(etc) This is transformed to the equivalent, but untimed version: proc P(d:D, last_action_time:Real) = sum e0:E0 c0(d,e0)^t0(d,e0)>last_action_time -> a0(f0(d,e0)) . P(g0(d,e0),t0(d,e0)) + sum e1:E1 c1(d,e1)^t1(d,e1)>last_action_time -> a1(f1(d,e1)) . P(g1(d,e1),t1(d,e1)) + ...(etc) An LPE of the last form is written to &outfile; (or &stdout; if not specified).
